sen.j: 花宴（はなのえん）は、『源氏物語』五十四帖の巻名の一つ。
sen.e: Hana no En (The Festival of the Cherry Blossoms) is the title of one of the fifty-four chapters of "The Tale of Genji."

sen.j: 如月に紫宸殿で催された桜花の宴で、光源氏は頭中将らと共に漢詩を作り舞を披露した。
sen.e: At the festival of the cherry blossoms at the Shishinden (The Throne Hall) in February, Hikaru Genji composed Chinese poems and showed off dances together with To no Chujo and others.

sen.j: 宴の後、朧月夜に誘われふと入り込んだ弘徽殿で、源氏は若い姫君と出逢い契りを交わす。
sen.e: After it ended, Genji happened to enter the Kokiden building due to the alluring night with a hazy spring moon, met a young lady there and had an affair with her.

sen.j: 素性も知らぬままに扇を取り交わして別れた姫君こそ、朱雀帝への入内が決まっている右大臣の六の君（朧月夜_(源氏物語)）だった。
sen.e: The lady, who he exchanged fans with and said good-bye to without knowing who she was, was the sixth daughter of the Udaijin (Oborozukiyo (The Tale of Genji)) who was to enter the court of Emperor Suzaku.

sen.j: 一月後、右大臣家の藤花の宴に招かれた。
sen.e: A month later, Genji was invited to the banquet of the wisteria at the residence of the Udaijin.

sen.e: He appeared there in carefully chosen dress, asked by composing poems and found the lady he was searching for.
